title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.23 | 19-04-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyanan Janashalakaya
Chakshurun Meelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale
Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine
Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda
Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare
Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya
Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udeerayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 23rd words of the 9th chapter.
The meaning of this verse is
The personality of Godhead who appears in the mind of the devotee by attentive devotion and meditation
and by chanting of the holy name
releases the devotee from the body of God.
The body of God is the bondage of fruitive activities at the time of squinting the material body.
So Bhishma is the authority.
Mahajana.
He is explaining how when the Lord appears in the mind of the devotee
by attentive devotion.
Meditation.
Chanting of the holy name.
So that is explained here. VACHA YANNAM KIRTAYAN. So by chanting of the holy name,
by attentive devotion and meditation, the Lord releases the devotee from the bondage
of fructive activities exactly at the time of quitting the body. So Srila Prabhupada explains
in the purport, yoga means concentration of the mind detached from all other subject matter.
Simultaneously, concentration of the mind on the lotus feet of Krishna or on the holy name of
Krishna or on the form of Krishna, this transcendental form of Krishna, while simultaneously being
completely detached from all other subject matter. So such concentration, Srila Prabhupada explains,
is Samadhi.
The highest perfection of yoga or cent per cent engagement in the service of the Lord.
Even though a devotee is not, may not be engaged in Ashtanga Yoga practice, in Bhakti Yoga
also the same perfection of Ashtanga Yoga called Samadhi or cent per cent absorption
in the Supreme Lord is possible.
By cent per cent engagement in devotional service of the Lord, either through chanting
or through hearing or through worshipping or through remembering the Lord's pastimes,
the Lord's form, the Lord's name. So Srila Prabhupada further explains, one who concentrates
his attention in that manner is called a yogi.
devotee means bhakti yogi of the lord engages himself 24 hours daily in the service of the lord
so that his whole attention is engrossed with the thoughts of the lord in ninefold devotional service
devotional service is rendered in nine different ways this is explained in the seventh cant of the
Srimad Bhagavatam so Srila Prabhupada has given the English names hearing chanting
remembering worshiping praying becoming a voluntary servant carrying out orders establishing
a friendly relationship or offering all that one may possess in the service of the Lord
Atmaniveenam last one by such practice of yoga or linking up in the service of the lord
one is recognized by the lord himself as it is explained in the Bhagavad Gita concerning
the highest perfectional stage of samadhi in the Bhagavad Gita 6th chapter Krishna explains
this total advantage
absorption of the mind in devotional service is actually Samadhi. The Lord calls such a
rare devotee, the best amongst all the Yogis, Yoginam api sarvesham madhgate na antaratmana
sraddhavan bhajate yomam same yukta tamo matah. Yukta, yukta tara, yukta tama. Positives,
comparative and superlative. So, the best amongst all Yogis, yukta tamo matah,
Yoginam api sarvesham, among all Yogis, the best amongst all Yogis is a
a devotee who is totally
absorbed in devotional service of the Supreme Lord 24 hours a day. Such a
perfect Yogi is enabled by the divine grace of the Lord to concentrate his
mind upon the Lord with a perfect sense of consciousness. What is the meaning of
sense of consciousness? Even though physically
physically, physically, physically, physically, physically, physically,
we may be doing so many activities, even though mentally we may be engaging in different kinds of
thoughts, but in the background, the consciousness, which is the energy of the soul, is very important
consideration. What is the background consciousness? Generally, those who are non-devotees,
their background consciousness is that of sense enjoyment,
or self-gratification, the sense of independent existence without any connection with Krishna,
the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Such a sense of consciousness, independent existence,
is actually the reason for the material bondage. And the opposite of this is the sense of belonging
to Krishna eternally, absolute dependence on Krishna. And this sense of consciousness
is called the perfect sense of consciousness, where one is able to concentrate the attention
completely on Krishna.
By the divine grace of Krishna, such concentration is not possible without the mercy of the Lord.
And the Lord is very, very merciful and kind to his pure devotee, unflinching servitor.
Thus, by chanting his holy name before quitting the body, the yogi is at once transferred
by the internal energy of the Lord.
To one of the eternal planets, where there is no question of material life, and its concomitant
factors. See what happens at the time of death, the devotee quits the body, chanting
the holy name of the Supreme Lord, because he has practiced chanting constantly, always.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Kirtaniya Satatam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
Satatam kirtayam domaam.
The devotee is at once transferred by the internal energy of the Lord.
This has been explained by Krishna in the Bhagavad Gita.
This Daivim Prakriti is referring to the internal energy of the Lord.
The personal energy which is specially meant for his devotees.
For the Lord and his devotees, this personal energy which is the yoga maya, antaranga shakti, spiritual energy.
As opposed to this, there is the material energy or maha maya or trigunatmaka maya, gunamayi maya.
So this gunamayi maya offers an obstacle for those who want to get out of this material existence.
It offers an obstacle, duratyaya.
And the yoga maya or the atma maya, personal energy of the Lord,
simply transfers the devotee immediately, at once.
To the eternal planets.
And what is the nature of eternal planets?
Parastasma tu bhavonyo vyakto vyakta sanatana.
Sanatana.
Those planets are sanatana.
Where there is no question of material life and its concomitant factors.
Material life is characterized by repetition of birth and death.
And between birth and death, there is janma mrittyu jara vyadhi dukha dosha anudarshanam.
Again and again, repeatedly, we have to face these concomitant factors of disease, old age, death, rebirth, disease, old age, death and rebirth.
We have to keep on facing these concomitant factors.
In the eternal planets, there is no death, there is no old age.
This knowledge is not known to many people.
That there is another world, Parastasmatubhavonyo, Anyabhava, that is transcendental, Paraha.
Parambhavam, or Parambrahma, Paramdhama.
So this Paramdhama, so that transcendental world, that is unknown to people.
They read Bhagavad Gita, but because they are not guided by the proper,
the proper authority, therefore they do not know that Krishna doesn't belong to this world.
They do not know Krishna is a transcendental supreme personality.
He has his personal abode. He is inviting us, please come back to my personal abode.
Don't remain in this material world which is subject to creation and destruction repeatedly.
Bhutva Bhutva Praliyate.
Everything is explained in the Bhagavad Gita very clearly.
But if you are not...
If you are not guided by a pure devotee, spiritual master,
you will never understand all these things merely by your reading the Gita.
Or following some translation which is done by a speculator, non-devotee.
You will never understand all these facts.
So here it is explained that simply by practicing devotional service
and preparing oneself to...
to be able to chant the holy name at the time of death,
one can simply transfer oneself to the eternal planets
where there is no repetition of birth and death.
I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
